1.content:
I've rewritten all of my TransUnion, Experian, and Equifax Viobox violation descriptions based on your original audit of my case. These rewrites reflect your guidance on updated FCRA codes, severity, and narrative strength.

Please:

Verify each FCRA code is correctly applied

Improve or tighten language where needed

Flag any redundancy or fields that could be merged

Suggest any additional violations I missed

Confirm if each entry reflects negligence vs. willfulness

These rewrites form the backbone of my Viotagger system â€” a visual FCRA violation mapping tool used in VioVerse. Your legal reasoning will finalize these templates for real-world use by attorneys, regulators, and case builders.

__________________________________________________________

ðŸ”µ TransUnion (Updated â€“ Post-Claude Review)
__________________________________________________________

Date Updated: 02/19/2024
Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681e(b), Â§1681n
Creditor updated account 10 days after bankruptcy discharge but failed to correct false bankruptcy status, indicating actual knowledge and willful noncompliance.

Pay Status: >Account Included in Bankruptcy<
Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681e(b), Â§1681c(a)(1)
Account falsely reports active bankruptcy inclusion after Feb 9, 2024 discharge. Should state 'Discharged' or 'Closed.' Misleads future lenders and violates post-discharge accuracy requirements.

Date Closed: 02/19/2024
Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681e(b)
Closure date manipulated to match update date instead of reflecting actual discharge on Feb 9, 2024. Backdating suggests intentional delay in compliance.

Remarks: CHAPTER 13 BANKRUPTCY
Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681e(b)
Bankruptcy remark remained unchanged after discharge. Must be updated to reflect 'Discharged through Chapter 13' or removed entirely.

On Record Until: 09/2025
Â§1681e(b), Â§1681c(a)(1), Â§1681c(a)(4)
Removal date calculated from incorrect triggering event. Post-discharge accounts must follow the 7-year rule from date of first delinquency or discharge, whichever is earlier.


__________________________________________________________

ðŸŸ  Experian (Updated â€“ Post-Claude Review)
__________________________________________________________

Status: Discharged through Bankruptcy Chapter 13
Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681c(a)(4), Â§1681e(b)
Status field shows â€œDischarged,â€ but full account accuracy must reflect that status across all related fields â€” balance, payment history, and update dates. Partial compliance is misleading.

Status Updated: Oct 2018
Â§1681c(a)(4), Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681n
Status date frozen over 5 years before discharge. Failure to update post-February 9, 2024 indicates reckless disregard and willful noncompliance.

Balance: -
Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681e(b)
Balance field blank or missing after discharge. Should reflect $0 or clearly state â€œDischargedâ€ to comply with post-bankruptcy accuracy obligations.

Balance Updated: -
Â§1681s-2(a)(8), Â§1681e(b), Â§1681c(a)(4)
No update date shown after discharge. Violates statutory duty to update account information and provide accurate timeline of changes.

Recent Payment: -
Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681e(b)
Payment history not shown. Post-discharge accounts should show last valid pre-bankruptcy activity or display â€œN/Aâ€ if obligation was discharged.

Monthly Payment: -
Â§1681e(b)
Monthly payment field blank. For discharged debts, this should either be $0 or omitted entirely to prevent misleading payment expectations.

Highest Balance: -
Â§1681e(b)
Historical high balance missing. While less critical individually, absence of this data contributes to overall pattern of incomplete or abandoned reporting.

On Record Until: Oct 2025
Â§1681e(b), Â§1681c(a)(1), Â§1681c(a)(4)
Account removal date miscalculated. Should reflect 7 years from discharge date (Feb 2031) or from the date of first delinquency, not arbitrary default.

__________________________________________________________

ðŸ”´ Equifax (Updateod â€“ Pst-Claude Review)
__________________________________________________________


Account Status: INCLUDED_IN_CHAPTER_13
Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681e(b), Â§1681n
CRITICAL: Account falsely reports active Chapter 13 inclusion after discharge on February 9, 2024. This directly contradicts legal status and demonstrates willful noncompliance.

Reported Balance: $0
Â§1681e(b), Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A)
Zero balance shown while account status still lists active bankruptcy. This internal contradiction reveals unreliable or negligent data handling.

Available Credit
Â§1681e(b), Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A)
Available credit missing or inaccurate. For discharged revolving accounts, this field should show $0 or be removed entirely.

High Credit
Â§1681e(b)
High credit value missing or not accurately retained. Weakens completeness and consistency of the credit file.

Credit Limit
Â§1681e(b), Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A)
Credit limit inaccurate or absent. Post-discharge accounts should show limit as $0 or marked closed.

Balance: $0
Â§1681e(b)
Duplicate of â€œReported Balance.â€ Should be merged or reconciled with that field. Blank or $0 balances must still match updated status fields.

Date Reported: Oct 25, 2018
Â§1681c(a)(4), Â§1681e(b), Â§1681s-2(a)(8), Â§1681n
Date field frozen over 5 years before the discharge. This long-term failure to update demonstrates abandonment of reinvestigation duties and supports willful classification.

Bankruptcy Chapter 13
Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681e(b)
Field references bankruptcy but omits â€œDischargedâ€ or closing context. Misleads users about current legal status of account.

Bankruptcy Completed
Â§1681e(b)
Field may be technically correct but incomplete. Must explicitly state â€œDischarged February 9, 2024â€ to ensure clarity and full accuracy.

1.content:
ðŸ§  Instruction to Claude: Case Integration and Connection Mapping
You are reviewing a complete collection of dispute letters, denial letters, and supporting documents from a live FCRA violation case. The legal backbone has already been validated â€” now your role is to analyze, connect, and organize the documents across time, creditors, and statutes.

ðŸŽ¯ Your Goals:
Build Relationships Across Evidence

Group related items (e.g., a dispute letter and the creditorâ€™s response)

Link denial letters to the specific violations or creditors that caused them

Identify cause â†’ effect patterns (e.g., misreporting â†’ score drop â†’ denial)

Construct a Chronological Legal Narrative

Use February 9, 2024 as the legal inflection point

Place each document on a timeline of harm and response

Mark which documents are pre-discharge, post-discharge, or trigger-related

Map Violations to Harm

Match each creditor's violations to emotional, financial, or legal harm

Identify when a single error causes multiple downstream impacts

Highlight Escalation-Ready Evidence

Flag documents that strongly demonstrate:

Willful noncompliance

Ongoing harm (e.g., repeated denials)

Clear financial loss or opportunity cost

Prepare for System Integration

Structure your findings so they can be tagged, sorted, and visualized in VioCore and VioNarrative modules

Use consistent metadata: creditor, bureau, date, violation type, severity

âœ… Output Style (Optional Suggestions):
If you'd like Claude to give you structured output, suggest:

âœ… A summary table of document connections

âœ… A timeline of violations and harms

âœ… A relationship graph of letters â†’ denials â†’ impacts

âœ… Suggestions for evidence groupings in the UI or automation

ðŸ“Œ Final Reminder:
This is not just a document review â€” itâ€™s the foundation of a systemic harm narrative, ready to be used in legal action, visual storytelling, or regulatory complaints. Make the invisible connections visible.

1.content:
âœ… CLAUDE CODE REVIEW PROMPT:
Purpose: Deep legal audit of pre-written Viotagger violation descriptions against the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) using my February 9, 2024 discharge date as the central legal trigger.

ðŸ”’ SYSTEM CONTEXT
You are assisting in a highly structured FCRA enforcement system called VioTagger, which powers a legal-tech platform called VioVerse. This system identifies, classifies, and presents credit reporting violations using exact coordinates on PNG versions of credit reports. Each Viobox represents a known or suspected FCRA violation, with:

X,Y,W,H pixel coordinates on the credit report image

Creditor code (e.g., AL for Ally)

Bureau (EQ/EX/TU)

Report date (e.g., 2024-04-25)

Weâ€™ve pre-written standard violation descriptions for 99% of recurring data elements found in reports from Equifax, Experian, and TransUnion, all centered on my bankruptcy discharge and post-discharge reporting violations.

These pre-written entries include:

The field name shown on the credit report (e.g., "Account Status: INCLUDED_IN_CHAPTER_13")

The FCRA statute(s) we determined apply (e.g., Â§1681c(f), Â§1681e(b))

A description for reviewers and attorneys (e.g., "Account misreported as active in Chapter 13 after discharge")

ðŸ“Œ LEGAL TRIGGER: FEBRUARY 9, 2024
This date is the confirmed discharge date of my Chapter 13 bankruptcy. It is the legal threshold that separates protected bankruptcy-era reporting from mandatory post-discharge accuracy.

Any creditor or bureau reporting after this date has an affirmative legal duty to:

Remove or update bankruptcy-related notations (e.g., â€œIncluded in Chapter 13â€)

Stop reporting delinquencies or balances that were discharged

Reflect account closure, $0 balance, or â€œDischarged through Chapter 13â€

Update all fields (Status, Balance, Payment, Remarks, Dates) to align with the discharge

Any failure to do so after this date is either:

Negligent (Â§1681o) or

Willful (Â§1681n) noncompliance,
depending on the presence of continued monthly reporting or updates.

ðŸ§  YOUR TASK: FCRA REASONING & DESCRIPTION VALIDATION
Go field by field using the tables below. For each violation entry:

Assess the FCRA code(s) listed. Are they the most precise?

Enhance or revise the written descriptions if needed â€” for clarity, legal specificity, or force.

Consider severity and whether additional violations may apply.

Suggest any new FCRA codes or notes where patterns suggest willfulness, repeated monthly reporting, or knowledge of discharge.

If anything is missing from our existing list of standardized descriptions, recommend additions.

ðŸ“‹ VIOLATION TEMPLATES (BY BUREAU)

Date Updated: 02/19/2024    Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681e(b)    Date updated but data still inaccurate

Date Closed: 02/19/2024    Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681e(b)    Wrong or backdated closure
Remarks: "CHAPTER 13 BANKRUPTCY"    Â§1681c(f), Â§1681e(b)    Misreported bankruptcy notation
On Record Until: 09/2025    Â§1681e(b), Â§1681c(a)(1)    Incorrect or outdated removal date

ðŸŸ  Experian

Status: "Discharged through Bankruptcy Chapter 13"    Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A), Â§1681c(a)(4), Â§1681e(b)    Status fails to reflect discharge update
Status Updated: Oct 2018    Â§1681c(a)(4), Â§1681s-2(a)(1)(A)    Stale 'Status Updated' field from years earlier
Balance: -    Â§1681e(b), Â§1681c(f)    Missing balance value post-discharge
Balance Updated: -    Â§1681e(b), Â§1681c(a)(4)    No recent balance update post-discharge
Recent Payment: -    Â§1681e(b)    Missing/blank payment activity
Monthly Payment: -    Â§1681e(b)    Monthly payment field missing
Highest Balance: -    Â§1681e(b)    Missing highest balance field
On Record Until: Oct 2025    Â§1681e(b), Â§1681c(a)(1)    Incorrect or outdated removal date

ðŸ”´ Equifax
Field    Statute(s)    Description
Account Status: INCLUDED_IN_CHAPTER_13    Â§1681c(f), Â§1681e(b)    Account misreported as active in Chapter 13 after discharge
Reported Balance: $0    Â§1681e(b), Â§1681c(f)    Zero balance misreported with discharge context
Available Credit    Â§1681e(b)    Available credit field inaccurate or blank
High Credit    Â§1681e(b)    High credit not accurately reflected

Bankruptcy Completed    Â§1681e(b)    Status not updated after discharge

ðŸ“Ž ADDITIONAL FILES AVAILABLE
I can supply the following upon request:

ðŸ“ COMPONENT: static-footer-severity-key

ðŸ“ LOCATION:
Anchored at the bottom of the sidebar-top-stack (or bottom of full report canvas)

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

ðŸŽ¯ PURPOSE:
This static footer provides two critical elements:
1. A **severity key** legend for interpreting the color-coded violation icons  
2. A legal **disclaimer** indicating that overlays are for internal use only

It is always visible at the bottom of the display. It does not collapse or animate.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

ðŸ§­ POSITIONING + LAYOUT:

- This component is **permanently anchored to the bottom of the report viewer container**
- It must always appear, regardless of scroll or toggle states
- There must be a minimum of **24px vertical padding** between this footer and the element above it (e.g., "view full violation log")

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

ðŸ§± SEVERITY KEY ROW:

- Label: `severity key:` (lowercase)
- Font: Space Grotesk
- Font size: 14 ptt
- Font weight: bold
- Color: #253541

- Horizontal spacing between severity items: 25 px
- Vertical alignment: Icons and text should be vertically centered

ðŸ“ COMPONENT: view-full-violation-log-button

ðŸ“ LOCATION:
sidebar-top-stack â†’ directly below the last rendered violation-details box

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

ðŸŽ¯ PURPOSE:
Displays a static button or link at the end of the `violation-details` list. It provides users â€” especially legal professionals â€” with access to the **complete violation history or log**, beyond what is currently shown on screen.

This component is **always visible**, regardless of how many violations are included in the summary. It serves as a persistent gateway to the full system-wide violation dataset.

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

ðŸ§­ FUNCTIONAL BEHAVIOR:

- Clicking the button will eventually trigger one of the following (to be defined in development):
  â€¢ Opens a modal  
  â€¢ Navigates to a new page (e.g., `/full-log`)  
  â€¢ Expands a drawer or accordion panel  
  â€¢ Triggers a filtered export (optional)

- This element **does not collapse** and does not toggle
- It must remain accessible even if `violation-details` is collapsed
- Keyboard/tab-navigable; screen reader accessible

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

ðŸ”¤ BUTTON LABEL TEXT:

- Default text: `view full violation log`
- Font: Bernino Sans Compressed Extrabold
- Font size: 24pt
- Color: `#253541` at 90% opacity
- Letter spacing: normal
- x = 1370 px

- Size: 28px x 28px

- Position:
  â€¢ Horizontally: Fixed at `x: 1564 px`

â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€

cachedChangelog:
# Changelog

## 1.0.18

- Added --add-dir CLI argument for specifying additional working directories
- Added streaming input support without require -p flag
- Improved startup performance and session storage performance
- Added CLAUDE_BASH_MAINTAIN_PROJECT_WORKING_DIR environment variable to freeze working directory for bash commands
- Added detailed MCP server tools display (/mcp)
- MCP authentication and permission improvements
- Added auto-reconnection for MCP SSE connections on disconnect
- Fixed issue where pasted content was lost when dialogs appeared

## 1.0.17

- We now emit messages from sub-tasks in -p mode (look for the parent_tool_use_id property)
- Fixed crashes when the VS Code diff tool is invoked multiple times quickly
- MCP server list UI improvements
- Update Claude Code process title to display "claude" instead of "node"

## 1.0.11

- Claude Code can now also be used with a Claude Pro subscription
- Added /upgrade for smoother switching to Claude Max plans
- Improved UI for authentication from API keys and Bedrock/Vertex/external auth tokens
- Improved shell configuration error handling
- Improved todo list handling during compaction

## 1.0.10

- Added markdown table support
- Improved streaming performance

## 1.0.8

- Fixed Vertex AI region fallback when using CLOUD_ML_REGION
- Increased default otel interval from 1s -> 5s
- Fixed edge cases where MCP_TIMEOUT and MCP_TOOL_TIMEOUT weren't being respected
- Fixed a regression where search tools unnecessarily asked for permissions
- Added support for triggering thinking non-English languages
- Improved compacting UI

## 1.0.7

- Renamed /allowed-tools -> /permissions
- Migrated allowedTools and ignorePatterns from .claude.json -> settings.json
- Deprecated claude config commands in favor of editing settings.json
- Fixed a bug where --dangerously-skip-permissions sometimes didn't work in --print mode
- Improved error handling for /install-github-app
- Bugfixes, UI polish, and tool reliability improvements

## 1.0.6

- Improved edit reliability for tab-indented files
- Respect CLAUDE_CONFIG_DIR everywhere
- Reduced unnecessary tool permission prompts
- Added support for symlinks in @file typeahead
- Bugfixes, UI polish, and tool reliability improvements

## 1.0.4

- Fixed a bug where MCP tool errors weren't being parsed correctly

## 1.0.1

- Added `DISABLE_INTERLEAVED_THINKING` to give users the option to opt out of interleaved thinking.
- Improved model references to show provider-specific names (Sonnet 3.7 for Bedrock, Sonnet 4 for Console)
- Updated documentation links and OAuth process descriptions

## 1.0.0

- Claude Code is now generally available
- Introducing Sonnet 4 and Opus 4 models

## 0.2.125

- Breaking change: Bedrock ARN passed to `ANTHROPIC_MODEL` or `ANTHROPIC_SMALL_FAST_MODEL` should no longer contain an escaped slash (specify `/` instead of `%2F`)
- Removed `DEBUG=true` in favor of `ANTHROPIC_LOG=debug`, to log all requests

## 0.2.117

- Breaking change: --print JSON output now returns nested message objects, for forwards-compatibility as we introduce new metadata fields
- Introduced settings.cleanupPeriodDays
- Introduced CLAUDE_CODE_API_KEY_HELPER_TTL_MS env var
- Introduced --debug mode

## 0.2.108

- You can now send messages to Claude while it works to steer Claude in real-time
- Introduced BASH_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_MS and BASH_MAX_TIMEOUT_MS env vars
- Fixed a bug where thinking was not working in -p mode
- Fixed a regression in /cost reporting
- Deprecated MCP wizard interface in favor of other MCP commands
- Lots of other bugfixes and improvements

## 0.2.107

- CLAUDE.md files can now import other files. Add @path/to/file.md to ./CLAUDE.md to load additional files on launch

## 0.2.106

- MCP SSE server configs can now specify custom headers
- Fixed a bug where MCP permission prompt didn't always show correctly

## 0.2.105

- Claude can now search the web
- Moved system & account status to /status
- Added word movement keybindings for Vim
- Improved latency for startup, todo tool, and file edits

## 0.2.102

- Improved thinking triggering reliability
- Improved @mention reliability for images and folders
- You can now paste multiple large chunks into one prompt

## 0.2.100

- Fixed a crash caused by a stack overflow error
- Made db storage optional; missing db support disables --continue and --resume

## 0.2.98

- Fixed an issue where auto-compact was running twice

## 0.2.96

- Claude Code can now also be used with a Claude Max subscription (https://claude.ai/upgrade)

## 0.2.93

- Resume conversations from where you left off from with "claude --continue" and "claude --resume"
- Claude now has access to a Todo list that helps it stay on track and be more organized

## 0.2.82

- Added support for --disallowedTools
- Renamed tools for consistency: LSTool -> LS, View -> Read, etc.

## 0.2.75

- Hit Enter to queue up additional messages while Claude is working
- Drag in or copy/paste image files directly into the prompt
- @-mention files to directly add them to context
- Run one-off MCP servers with `claude --mcp-config <path-to-file>`
- Improved performance for filename auto-complete

## 0.2.74

- Added support for refreshing dynamically generated API keys (via apiKeyHelper), with a 5 minute TTL
- Task tool can now perform writes and run bash commands

## 0.2.72

- Updated spinner to indicate tokens loaded and tool usage

## 0.2.70

- Network commands like curl are now available for Claude to use
- Claude can now run multiple web queries in parallel
- Pressing ESC once immediately interrupts Claude in Auto-accept mode

## 0.2.69

- Fixed UI glitches with improved Select component behavior
- Enhanced terminal output display with better text truncation logic

## 0.2.67

- Shared project permission rules can be saved in .claude/settings.json

## 0.2.66

- Print mode (-p) now supports streaming output via --output-format=stream-json
- Fixed issue where pasting could trigger memory or bash mode unexpectedly

## 0.2.63

- Fixed an issue where MCP tools were loaded twice, which caused tool call errors

## 0.2.61

- Navigate menus with vim-style keys (j/k) or bash/emacs shortcuts (Ctrl+n/p) for faster interaction
- Enhanced image detection for more reliable clipboard paste functionality
- Fixed an issue where ESC key could crash the conversation history selector

## 0.2.59

- Copy+paste images directly into your prompt
- Improved progress indicators for bash and fetch tools
- Bugfixes for non-interactive mode (-p)

## 0.2.54

- Quickly add to Memory by starting your message with '#'
- Press ctrl+r to see full output for long tool results
- Added support for MCP SSE transport

## 0.2.53

- New web fetch tool lets Claude view URLs that you paste in
- Fixed a bug with JPEG detection

## 0.2.50

- New MCP "project" scope now allows you to add MCP servers to .mcp.json files and commit them to your repository

## 0.2.49

- Previous MCP server scopes have been renamed: previous "project" scope is now "local" and "global" scope is now "user"

## 0.2.47

- Press Tab to auto-complete file and folder names
- Press Shift + Tab to toggle auto-accept for file edits
- Automatic conversation compaction for infinite conversation length (toggle with /config)

## 0.2.44

- Ask Claude to make a plan with thinking mode: just say 'think' or 'think harder' or even 'ultrathink'

## 0.2.41

- MCP server startup timeout can now be configured via MCP_TIMEOUT environment variable
- MCP server startup no longer blocks the app from starting up

## 0.2.37

- New /release-notes command lets you view release notes at any time
- `claude config add/remove` commands now accept multiple values separated by commas or spaces

## 0.2.36

- Import MCP servers from Claude Desktop with `claude mcp add-from-claude-desktop`
- Add MCP servers as JSON strings with `claude mcp add-json <n> <json>`

## 0.2.34

- Vim bindings for text input - enable with /vim or /config

## 0.2.32

- Interactive MCP setup wizard: Run "claude mcp add" to add MCP servers with a step-by-step interface
- Fix for some PersistentShell issues

## 0.2.31

- Custom slash commands: Markdown files in .claude/commands/ directories now appear as custom slash commands to insert prompts into your conversation
- MCP debug mode: Run with --mcp-debug flag to get more information about MCP server errors

## 0.2.30

- Added ANSI color theme for better terminal compatibility
- Fixed issue where slash command arguments weren't being sent properly
- (Mac-only) API keys are now stored in macOS Keychain

## 0.2.26

- New /approved-tools command for managing tool permissions
- Word-level diff display for improved code readability
- Fuzzy matching for slash commands

## 0.2.21

- Fuzzy matching for /commands
